    • Method Detail

      • registerEventPublisher

        public java.util.Optional<EventPublisher> registerEventPublisher(Identification identification)
        with this method you can register EventPublisher add a Source of Events to the System.

        This method represents a higher level of abstraction! Use the EventManager to fire Events! This method is intended for use cases where you have an entire new source of events (e.g. network)

        Parameters:
        identification - the Identification of the Source
        Returns:
        An Optional Object which may or may not contains an EventPublisher

      • unregisterEventPublisher

        public void unregisterEventPublisher(Identification identification)
        with this method you can unregister EventPublisher add a Source of Events to the System.

        This method represents a higher level of abstraction! Use the EventManager to fire Events! This method is intended for use cases where you have an entire new source of events (e.g. network)

        Parameters:
        identification - the Identification of the Source

      • registerEventsController

        public void registerEventsController(EventsController eventsController)
        Registers an EventController to control EventDispatching-Behaviour

        Method is thread-safe. It is expected that this method executes quickly.

        Parameters:
        eventsController - the EventController Interface to control event-dispatching

      • unregisterEventsController

        public void unregisterEventsController(EventsController eventsController)
        Unregisters an EventController

        Method is thread-safe.

        Parameters:
        eventsController - the EventController Interface to remove
